intro: Goniopteris obliterata, commonly known as the obliterate water fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in diameter. The leaves are usually divided into four lobes and have a distinctive, rounded shape. This aquatic plant is often found in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. It plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small organisms and contributing to water filtration.
